definition: urgent
urgent/pressing/rapid/hurried/worried/to make (sb) anxious
to demand/to request/to coerce
important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if

sentences.english: 12They are like a lion hungry for prey, like a great lion crouching in cover.
sentences.chinese: 他像狮子急要抓食，又像少壮狮子蹲伏在暗处。

sentences.english: Tom could hardly wait to try out his new bike.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆等不急要马上试他的新车。

sentences.english: Like as a lion that is greedy of his prey, and as it were a young lion lurking in secret places.
sentences.chinese: 他像狮子急要抓食，又像少壮狮子蹲伏在暗处。

sentences.english: I can't wait to see the look on my face when you pull me out of there.
sentences.chinese: 我等不急要看脸上的表情当你把握带出的时候。

sentences.english: Where have you got to be in such a rush?
sentences.chinese: 你这么急要赶到哪里去呢？

definition: to need sth urgently/urgently required
most urgent/posthaste/express
extremely urgent
to help/to do a favor/(Shanghainese) Come on!/Give me a break!
lit. the fire burns one's eyebrows (idiom); fig. desperate situation/extreme emergency
excuse me
variant of 耽擱|耽搁[dan1 ge5]
to rush/in a hurry/to worry about being late
to need the toilet/urinary or defecatory urgency
thus/in this way/like this
to talk at length/to waste one's breath/variant of 廢話|废话[fei4 hua4]
to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/vexation/inconvenience
lit. as hurried as a shooting star (idiom); requiring immediate action/extremely urgent
not enough time (to do sth)/too late (to do sth)
(coll.) tomorrow/one of these days/some day
worried/anxious
